subject: Religion & Spirituality
title: Stem Cells and the Soul
description: A fast breakdown of Stem Cells and the Soul for builders.

hook.text: Embryonic stem cells can cure diseases. But harvesting them destroys embryos. If embryos have souls, is research murder?

buildup.text: Stem cell research uses early embryos to harvest cells that can become any tissue in the body. The potential is huge.

discovery.text: The Catholic Church says life begins at conception. Destroying an embryo, even for research, violates human dignity.

twist.text: Scientists developed induced pluripotent stem cells from adult tissue. Technology may sidestep the ethical dilemma.

climax.text: The stem cell debate shows science creates possibilities faster than ethics can evaluate them. Speed outpaces wisdom.

punchline.text: Science moves fast. Ethics moves slow. Stem cells exposed the gap.

quiz.question: Why is embryonic stem cell research controversial?
options: It destroys embryos, raising questions about when life and personhood begin
